James D. Crawford, Deputy District Attorney, and Arlen Specter, District Attorney, for respondent.
OPINION BY MR. JUSTICE NIX, May 8, 1973:
The principal issue presented in this consolidated appeal is whether a probation violation hearing may *105 be held prior to the trial for criminal charges which are based on the same activities which gave rise to the alleged probation violation. In each of these cases the hearing judge held, or attempted to hold, the violation of probation hearing prior to the probationer's trial on the substantive offense. Commonwealth v. Kates and Commonwealth v. McClellan are appeals from probation revocations and judgments of sentence imposed; Allen v.
